events.title: Emancipation Proclamation Announced
events.description: President Abraham Lincoln issued a preliminary version of the Emancipation Proclamation, declaring that all slaves in Confederate-held territory would be free as of January 1, 1863.
events.significance: This was a pivotal step in the abolition of slavery in the United States and altered the character of the Civil War, adding moral force to the Union cause.

events.title: Founding of Harvard University
events.description: Harvard College was founded in Massachusetts, becoming the first institution of higher education in the United States.
events.significance: Harvard became a leading center for higher learning and a model for future universities in America.

events.title: The Night of the Long Knives Begins
events.description: Adolf Hitler launched a purge against the Sturmabteilung (SA) leadership and other political adversaries within Nazi Germany.
events.significance: This event consolidated Hitler's power and eliminated challenges to his leadership within the Nazi Party and Germany.

events.title: Launch of Sputnik 1
events.description: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 1, the world's first artificial satellite, into orbit around Earth.
events.significance: This marked the beginning of the space age and intensified the space race during the Cold War between the USA and USSR.

events.title: Independence of Armenia and Azerbaijan from the Soviet Union
events.description: Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union, Armenia and Azerbaijan declared their independence.
events.significance: Significantly changed the political landscape of the Caucasus region and highlighted the end of Soviet influence in Eastern Europe.
